ResourceHeader.AlternateName: Narrabri (although not used with data reports)
ResourceHeader.Description: Culgoora station is located in Narrabri, NSW. It has been in operation since 1965. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/Solar/2/2
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge: Space Weather Network, Bureau of Meteorology, Australia

InformationURL.Name: ASWS Observatory Information: Culgoora
InformationURL.Description: includes observatory/station name, location, lifetime, identity and datasets informtion.

InformationURL.Name: ASWS Culgoora Solar Observatory
InformationURL.Description: includes Culgoora Solar Observatory Overview and more details informtion.

ResourceHeader.Description:
The Culgoora Magnetometer station in Culgoora, NSW, Australia, has a Magnetometer since September 2003.
18 September, 2003 (RAM) ----------------- Data type: "I"
Bartington magnetometer MAG03-607 was installed with 24-bit A/D data acquisition system. Sensor alignment along geomagnetic EW was within 1 degree.
For more information, please read its log file.

InformationURL.Name: ASWS Culgoora Instrument Fluxgate Magenetometer Log File

ResourceHeader.Description: The Culgoora Solar Observatory in New South Wales, Australia, has a 12 cm telescope used for solar H-alpha imagery, a 30 cm heliostat used to observe sunspot evolution, and a radio spectrograph (which sweeps through a frequency range of 18-1800 MHz every 3 seconds) used for monitoring solar radio bursts. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/Solar/2/2.

The Culgoora Solar Observatory in New South Wales, Australia, has a 12 cm telescope used for solar H-alpha imagery, a 30 cm heliostat used to observe sunspot evolution, and a radio spectrograph (which sweeps through a frequency range of 18-1800 MHz every 3 seconds) used for monitoring solar radio bursts. See details at http://www.sws.bom.gov.au/Solar/2/2.
